summary:
Nova Scotia is a province in eastern Canada with over 1 million people. It's one of the three Maritime provinces and is made up of a peninsula and Cape Breton Island, plus 3,800 smaller islands. The capital, Halifax, is the largest city and home to almost half the province's people.

First inhabited by the Mi'kmaq, Nova Scotia was colonized by France and later fought over by France and Britain. Britain eventually won control and settled it with "foreign Protestants." In 1867, Nova Scotia joined with New Brunswick and the Province of Canada to form the country of Canada.
title: Nova Scotia
